speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about when you first started experiencing delayed menarche? Was there a specific age when you noticed you weren't getting your period like your friends?

speaker: Patient
text: To be honest, I've always felt a bit different from my friends when it comes to my body. I didn't really think much of it until my mom asked me if I was having my period during our last conversation, and I realized I hadn't gotten any since I was 12.

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about your overall health and well-being since you started experiencing delayed menarche? Did you notice any other symptoms such as fatigue, joint pain, or swelling?

speaker: Patient
text: To be honest, it's been really frustrating. I feel like I'm just growing and developing normally, but my body is doing things differently. I've had some pretty bad acne for a while now, and it's been really hard to deal with, especially since it's been affecting my self-esteem.

speaker: Doctor
text: So you started noticing delayed menarche around the age of 12, and by 13, you were already a year behind your friends. Did you experience any other physical symptoms, such as joint pain, swelling, or unusual bruising, around that time?

speaker: Patient
text: To be honest, it's been really frustrating. I feel like I'm just growing and developing normally, but my body is doing things differently. I've had some pretty bad acne for a while now, and it's been really hard to deal with, especially since it's been affecting my self-esteem. I've also had some issues with my bones, I mean, I've broken a few things that I shouldn't have, like when I fell off my bike and twisted my ankle, and that was really weird.

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you describe the nature of the joint pain you experienced, was it constant, or did it come and go, and did it affect your daily activities at all?

speaker: Patient
text: To be honest, the joint pain felt really sharp and stabbing, especially after minor injuries like falling off my bike. It would come and go, but when it did, I could barely move or even walk, it hurt so much. I remember missing a few days of school because I was too sore to go.

speaker: Doctor
text: It seems like you've been experiencing a lot of physical challenges. Can you tell me more about your daily activities and how the joint pain has affected your life, for example, do you have trouble doing certain sports or activities?

speaker: Patient
text: To be honest, I have to be really careful about the activities I participate in, especially contact sports. I don't really enjoy sports that require a lot of physical contact, like soccer or basketball, because I'm worried I might get hurt. I mostly stick to individual activities like swimming or running on the treadmill.

speaker: Doctor
text:
